fields.summary: Android: Can't create a custom url for the app
fields.environment:
Titanium SDK version: 2.0.1GA2
Javascript Engine: V8 
Platform & version: Android 2.3, 3.2 
Device Details: Android emulator and Acer Iconia A500 
Host Operating System: OSX 10.7.3 
Titanium Studio version: 2.0.2

comments.body: PR Ready: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/2492 For testing we will need to use a local web server. For some cases, the browser does not resolve "http://www.appcelerator.com" correctly if you type it directly into the url box. If you click on a link that is directly to 'http://appcelerator.com' then it always works correctly. This is native android behavior and we don't do anything on the titanium end: 1. Run an app with the code sample above 2. On a Mac: create a test.html file under ~/Sites/test.html 3. Add the following in test.html: {code} click me! {code} 4. Under system preferences > sharing, check off "web sharing" 5. Once you have done this, there should a url for your site, something like: http://192.168.1.104/~your_username/ 6. On your phone, connect to the same wifi network as your laptop, and type http://192.168.1.104/~your_username/test 7. Click on the "click me" link 8. It should prompt you to open either a browser or your app. Choose to open with your app. Expected Result: Your app should open with a button with the success message Actual Result: Currently, the app will open with a runtime error

Thanks! Tested this on my environment and worked fine!

Best,
Mauro

Environment used for verification -
Tested with Titanium SDK: 2.1.1.v20120716180600
Tested with Titanium Â Studio: 2.1.1.201207161421
Device - Android 2.2.2 LG-P970 
Machine OS - MAC 10.7.3
